data.current_summary: Get the status of the export including the URL to download the file
data.current_description: Returns the status of the export with taskId, including the URL of the resulting file if the export status is COMPLETE
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve export task status and download URL
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status of an asynchronous CRM export task identified by taskId. Returns the task status (e.g., PENDING, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETE, FAILED) and, if the export is complete, includes the URL to download the exported file. The download URL is only available when status is COMPLETE. Requires the taskId from the initial export request.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks clarity about what taskId parameter represents and when the download URL is available. Added context about task status states, parameter requirements, and conditional response behavior to improve AI agent understanding of when this operation should be called and what to expect.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/exports/export/async_start' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable. Original description is too generic and lacks actionable details. Added specificity about the asynchronous nature, request schema reference, response structure (TaskLocator and taskId), HTTP status code significance (202 Accepted), and the workflow pattern (initiate then poll status). This helps AI agents understand the operation's role in the export workflow and what to do with the response.

data.current_description: Begins exporting CRM data for the portal as specified in the request body
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous export of CRM data based on the export configuration provided in the request body (PublicExportRequest). Returns a 202 Accepted response with a TaskLocator containing the taskId that can be used to poll the export status via the status endpoint. The export process runs asynchronously in the background. Use the returned taskId to retrieve the export status and download URL once the export completes.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks actionable details. Added specificity about the asynchronous nature, request schema reference, response structure (TaskLocator and taskId), HTTP status code significance (202 Accepted), and the workflow pattern (initiate then poll status). This helps AI agents understand the operation's role in the export workflow and what to do with the response.
